climbs.name: Singles Awareness Crack
climbs.fa: B.Kensinger, N. Horton, G.Hopper, S. Borel 2/14/15

content.description: A low angled hand crack in a right facing flake.
content.location: A little ways left of Jonah

content.description: Start on the obvious slopey bulge with one good foot. Execute weird, desperate moves up the arete with a not-so-great heel hook on the starting holds. Make your way onto the slabby face and continue up and over the detached block.
content.location: This is the short, beautiful arete in the back of The Corridor. Look for the messy break in the trail about 5 min from the parking. Lots of dead trees. Scramble uphill and you'll see Amoraphobia on the right. Hop down into The Corridor and head all the way to the back.

content.description: Follow the broken bluffline about 100 yards down from where it starts, and you'll find this short straight-in hand crack. The FA was done as an onsight, ground up lead
content.location: Topout and belay from a tree above

content.description: What a great surprise, I really enjoyed The Whale but this climb is even better. The crux is getting through the first 10 feet of the crack in the very back of the cave. Traverse out from the chock-stones and if you aren't cluster phobic you can squeeze through the chimney. Otherwise dip below and come out the around the side of the flaring chimney until you reach a nice hand crack. From there you can face climb to the top. Look out for loose rock to avoid the unexpected whipper (thank you 0.5)
content.location: This climb starts in the back of the cave 20' to the left of The Whale (if looking at the wall from the trail).

content.description: This incredible line follows the obvious winding crack. Catch a good rest when the crack goes from horizontal to vertical, and execute some weird/desperate moves using the too-wide crack and awful face holds on the left.
content.protection: You could place a piece of pro, but would it really be worth it?
content.location: Pass The Corridor and some bolted routes. Keep your eyes out for the obvious crack after a slopey break in the cliffband. You can't miss this striking line.

content.description: This route is the obvious line you can see from the trail. Start with easy slabby moves on good holds. Move onto the beautiful left-leaning arete, navigate the perfect mono, and use good feet and the rail to top out. Not to tall, and has a decent landing. You'll definitely want a spotter, because blowing the crux hand-foot match will send you barndooring all the way down the hill and onto the trail.
content.location: Walk the trail from the parking for maybe 5 minutes and look for a break in the cliff band. Amoraphobia will be the first thing you come to on your right, up the hill, with the obvious left leaning rail. Hop down and into The Corridor for more!

content.description: A newer crag that is currently undergoing development.  It features a long, broken cliff line that has a lot of potential for both sport and trad routes.
